div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, SOUTHERN DIVISION.
Ex Parte in the Matter of Leroy Smith for Writ of Habeas Corpus. PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
TO THE HONORABLE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, SOUTHERN DIVISION:

Your Petitioner, Leroy Smith, respectfully shows that he, the said Lerory Smith is a citizen of the State of Arizona, and that he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained and restrained of his liberty in violation of the constitution by O. P. Halligan, Warden of the United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island, County of Pierce, State of Washigton; that the said imprisonment detention, confinement and restraint is illegal, and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to-wit: That on the 8th day of May, 1916, the grand jury in and for the United States District Court for the District of Arizona duly and regularly returned and presented unto the court an indictment in substance as follows, to wit: "The Grand Jurors of the United States, impaneled, sworn and charged at the term aforesaid, on their oath present that Leroy Smith on the 7th day of April, A.D., 1916, and within the said District of Arizona, did wrongfully, unlawfully and feloniously have in his possession and under his control a certain manufacture, derivative and preparation of opium, to-wit: five ounces of morphine, without first having registered with the Collector of Internal Revenue of the united States for the District of New Mexico, or with any collector of internal revenue of the United States, as required and provided for by an Act of Congress," etc. Second, "The Grand Jurors of the United States, impaneled, sworn and charged at the term aforesaid, of the court aforesaid, on their oath present that

Leroy Smiith, on the 7th day of April, A.D. 1916, within the District of Arizona, did wrongfully, unlawfully and feloniously have in his possession and under his control a certain manufacture, derivative and preparation of cocoa leaves, to-wit, five ounces of cocaine, without first having registered with the Collector of Internal Revenue of the United States for the District of New Mexico, or with any collector of internal revenue of the United States, as required and provided for by an Act of Congress entitled", etc. And each and every charge so set out in said indictment is made a part of this petition as if set out in haec verba.

That your Petitioner was arrested on said indictment and was arraigned thereon; that your Petitioner entered his plea of 'guilty' on May 15th, 1916, to the facts charged in said indictment, and was sentenced to serve one year and one day at the United States penitentiary at McNeil Island, Washington, by the Honorable William Sawtelle, United States District Judge in Arizona; that your Petitioner was thereafter and is now confined in said McNeil Island Penitentiary under sentence of said Honorable Court; that the judgment and sentence of said Court is null, illegal and void and of no effect for the reason that the acts charged in said information do not constitute any crime or offence against the Government of the United States; that the acts charged and provd against your Petitioner do not constitute any crime or offence against the law; that there is no evidence in the records to sustain the judgment that the court rendered against your Petitioner and ordered him confined in the McNeil Island Penitentiary at McNeil Island, Washington, and that the said confinement is without any authority in law, and that said commitment is null, void and illegal in that said commitment is for an alleged offence which in truth and in fact is not an offence against the United States or any statute thereof.

WHEREFORE, your Petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted, directed to O. P. Halligan, Warden of the United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island, Washington, and also the Honorable United States District Attorney for the District of Arizona, and your writ of certiorari to the Clerk of the United states District Court of the Arizona District in case Your Honors are pleased to order a full transcript of the record returned; that your Petitioner may be discharged from said unlawful custody, and that justice may be done him in all particulars according to law.
Leroy Smith Petitioner.
John J. Sullivan and Adam Beeler Counsel for Petitioner, 510 White Building, Seattle, Washington.
State of Washington County of Pierce } ss.

Leroy Smith being first duly sworn, on oath deposes and says that he has read the foregoing petition, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true of his own knowledge excepting the matters therein stated on information and belief, and as to those, he believes them to be true.
Leroy Smith
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 34th day of August, 1916.
Neel G Heuly Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at U.S. pent.

Let the writ issue returnable before this court at the Court Room of the United States District Court for the Western District at Tacoma, Washington, on the 23rd day of Oct., 1916, at the hour of 2 P.M. of said day.
Edward E. Cushman JUDGE.
ORIGINAL NO. 3345
In the Superior Court U.S. DISTRICT COURT, WESTERN DISTRICT, SOUTHERN DIVISION.
Ex Parte In the Matter of LEORY SMITH For Writ of Habeas Corpus
PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division OCT 16 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
BEELER & SULLIVAN Lawyers 310-11 White Building, Seattle, Wash. Main 207.
